name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Hotel Goldener Adler

reviews.text: Four of us booked to stay our last night in Austria here - after nine days of walking in the Stubai Alps. The hotel looked after our bags during that trip which was a huge help. Every member of reception staff were so friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to deluxe rooms - 102 and 104. What an unexpected treat. But I am sure all the rooms are very good. The hotel has real history and is bang in the middle of the old town. Our dinner outside was a great setting, but the service and food quality didn't match - I guess it's mass tourist catering and we should have known that. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. But perhaps have your evening meal elsewhere, or just don't have high expectations on that score. Everything else was 100%.
reviews.title: a real treat - the place and the staff

reviews.text: The front desk staff of this remarkable historic hotel catered to our family as if we, too, were royalty or Mozart! Not only were our rooms spacious , super clean and extremely tastefully appointed, but the two Austrian women (Danielle and Ulla?) took special care with the young children, one of whom was very tired and crying. A gentle mother's touch when ours wasn't quite doing the trick.
reviews.title: Felt welcomed: personal attention

reviews.text: Given its remarkable location in old town just steps from the town square and Golden Roof, and its immediate proximity to Innsbruck's hopping nightlife, I was surprised at how quiet and dark the rooms were at night.
reviews.title: Innsbruck's Best Hotel

reviews.text: Easy shopping and transportation access, this hotel boasts amenities galore (invluding a hearty fresh breakfast), comfy beds and pillows, and shining clean, beautifully updated bathrooms.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only drawback was that parking is a couple of blocks away, so unless you arrive before 10:30 am, you'll be like us hauling luggage through the bust streets. Well worth the trek, though! Do stay here, and also purchase your Innsbruck Pass from the front desk.
reviews.title: Hard to go past
Very Central
reviews.text: All staff were very helpful, location was right in the middle of the old town, hotel had lots of character. however no air conditioning lots of street noise early in the mornings and late at night made sleep difficult. Room was quite large, we ate in the restaurant inside hotel very good food and affordable. Would recommend for one night only.

We had trouble finding this hotel! We were warned that the hotel was located in a restricted area and the GPS kept taking us round and round the block. The hotel is only accessible by car before 10:00 am each day. After that the road is closed for pedestrians and outdoor dining. We finally parked in the underground car park nearby and carried out bags a good distance to the hotel. Incidentally, the hotel has special arrangements with the car park for discount overnight parking.
reviews.title: Great little Hotel in the Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent reception staff.
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise

reviews.text: Always cheerful and helpful with suggestions for dinner. They suggested Peppinos, an Italian Restaurant which we thought was excellent.
reviews.title: Would certainly return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly reception.
reviews.title: Sleep but not eat

reviews.text: Room ok:not so big but clean and modern. Nevre found how to adjust the air conditioning.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great location

reviews.text: Diner at the restaurant horrible and expensive for the quality, food and wine as well. Believe me nd ever try.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Even the breakfast was poor and very very slow.
reviews.title: The best of Austrian hospitality

reviews.text: We didn't plan to stay in Innsbruck but were fortunate to get a room at the last moment. What a great experience and what excellent value for money this hotel offers. The staff are amazing. The room was a new deluxe room with great views and we couldn't say enough about this hotel. The location is awesome. We tried the restaurant and food was excellent and well priced. We will diffently stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to anyone when visiting Innsbruck.
reviews.title: Hotel Goldener Adler, Innsbruck, Austria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Slap bang in the centre of town.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very traditional old-fashioned style hotel.
reviews.title: excellent location
Good central hotel , if a little noisy
reviews.text: We stayed here and used it as a base for a long weekend of skiing.
The hotel itself was fantastic, great amenities and excellent bathroom and very comfortable beds.
reviews.title: The Best of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were exceptionally helpful - storing our skis and equipment for us downstairs and providing a free car for trips to and from the ski hire shops.
reviews.title: Great stay

description: Welcome to BEST WESTERN PLUS Hotel Restaurant Goldener Adler, the hotel in Innsbruck, Tyrol, Austria. In the most central location in the very heart of the Old Town of Innsbruck and surrounded by tradition and history. Consequent rectification and well considered renovations make the Golden Eagle what it is today: the most centrally located First-Class-Hotel with all its comfort. The hotel is directly in the pedestrian zone of Innsbruck’s Old Town. Many sights and monuments like our famous Golden Roof, the Imperial Palace and the Imperial Church are situated within walking distance. The historic Old Town with the Golden Roof and the City Tower, the closeness to the Congress Centre, the University Hospital and all the shopping possibilities makes the Goldener Adler the perfect domicile and residence for tourists, salesmen, visitors of the Congress Centre and many different trade fairs. The family-run hotel in Innsbruck is well known for its charming hospitality and courteous staff. Our Clefs d’Or Concierge Ulli and our reception team are pleased to help you with organising theatre tickets, city tours, Tyrolean Evenings, Innsbruck-Cards and all other information. We all look forward to welcoming you Family Hackl with the Goldener Adler Team
